dt: {bc}to choose not to do or have something {bc}to refrain deliberately and often with an effort of self-denial from an action or practice

dt.t: Ten members voted for the proposal, six members voted against it, and two {wi}abstained{/wi}.

et: Middle English {it}absteinen, abstenen{/it}, borrowed from Anglo-French {it}asteign-, absteign-{/it}, stem of {it}astenir, abstenir{/it}, borrowed (with conjugation change, conformed to {it}tenir{/it}) from Latin {it}abstinēre{/it} "to keep from, hold back, refrain, withhold oneself from," from {it}abs-{/it} (variant of {it}ab-{/it} {et_link|ab-|ab-} before {it}c-{/it} and {it}t-{/it}) + {it}tenēre{/it} "to hold, occupy, possess" {ma}{mat|tenant:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to choose not to do or have something : to refrain deliberately and often with an effort of self-denial from an action or practice
